numbered_ace_sentences: 1. A legacy applicant applies to an elite college.
2. A regular applicant applies to an elite college.
3. A legacy applicant has a higher chance of admission than a regular applicant.
4. This holds if the legacy applicant and the regular applicant have the same income percentile.
5. A higher income can reduce the chance of admission.
6. Legacy status increases the chance of admission.
7. I wonder which elite schools were chosen for the graph.
8. Different colleges can have different perspectives on legacy backgrounds.
9. If one college has a different perspective on legacy backgrounds, then the data in the graph can change.
10. This can affect any community that has college applicants.
11. Citizens in a community differ in income.
12. Citizens in a community differ in college backgrounds.
13. Differences in income and college backgrounds can affect the college acceptance of the children of the citizens.
